a[href*="google"] {

- all the anchor elements that starts with "https" will be coded by this block. 

a[href$="https"] {
  color: yellow;
}

- to check if an element ends with a certain value. 

a[href^="https"][href$=".com"] {
  color: yellow;

  - start with https and end with .com

 <section id="products">

- decendent selector = #products p { } - - combining two different selectors here.

- if we have two p, using an article, we can youse #product > p { } and only get yellow marked on the longest..

- #products + p {
    color: yellow;
  }

  now, the third paragraph is orange. 

- #products ~ p {
    color: yellow;
  }

  - with this ~, every paragraph after the article will be yellow. 

- Relational selectors: decendent selector ~ , <, >, section, article
    cleaner markup 
    fragile: dependent, moving elements around. 
    not as fast as basic selectors. 
    = prefer select element by their id or class.

---------------------------------------------------------- 
selectors: p.first { font-size: 140; font-style: italic; } - now, this only
applies to the class of "first" what if we want it to apply to articles? article
p.first { font-size: 140; font-style: italic; }

<article>
  <p class="first">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet</p>
</article>

- psudo classes are classes that browser use by default, so the class="first" is
not really needed - So in the example above, we remove the class="first" and
instead write: article :first-child {}

<article>
  <h1>heading</h1>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet</p>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet</p>

  - because "heading" is the "first-child", it only applies to that: we only get the italics etc there. 
  - first-of-type includes heading and p below. why? first occourance of two different types

article p:first-of-type {
  font-size: 140;
  font-style: italic;
}

article p:last-of-type/last-child {
    font-weight: bold
}

- We use the p to refer to the paragraph, it only refers to the paragraph, and with last of type it refers to last paragrahp

a: hover = when you hover over anchored. 
a: focus = tab.

---------------------------------GRID---------------------

.container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template: 100px auto 100px / 30fr 70fr; 
  row-gap: 10px;
  column-gap: 10px;
  border: 3px solid grey;
  height: 100vh;
}

.box {
  background-color: gold;
}

.box-one {
  grid-column: 1 / -1; <--- using another class, and changing its location. its panning acorss 2 cells.
  grid-row: 
  grid-area: 3 (row)/ colum (2) 3 / 2 *start and end*
                                  
}

.container {
  display: grid;
  grid-template: 100px auto 100px / 30fr 70fr;
  grid-template-areas:
    "header  header"
    "sidebar  main"
    "footer  footer";
  row-gap: 10px;
  column-gap: 10px;
  border: 3px solid grey;
  height: 100vh;
}

.box {
  background-color: gold;
}

.box-one {
  grid-area: header;
}

.box-four {
  grid-area: footer;
}

.box-two {
  grid-area: sidebar;
}

.box-three {
  grid-area: main;
}


------------------HIDING TEMPLATES FROM BENTES ROM------------

  <body>
  <p class="first">first</p>
  <p>second</p>
  </body>

.first {
  visibility: hidden; <--- first is gone, but the space is still there
}

.first {
  display:none <--- first is completely gone and second has taken its place. 

}

--------------------------media queries------------------------

.container {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
}

.box {
  background-color: gold;
  padding: 1rem;
}

.box:nth-last-of-type(2) {
  background-color: dodgerblue;
}

@media screen and (min-width: 600px) { <----- if container is larger than 600px, the container will be row instead of collumn
  .container {
    flex-direction: row;
  }
}

@media screen and (min-width: 900px) { <---- if box is larger than 900, than box will be wihte. 
  .container {
    flex-direction: row;
  }
  .box {
    background-color: white;
  }
}

Printing: 

@media print {
  body {
    font-size: 12pt;
  }

  .box {
    padding: 0.5cm;
  }
}

- basically, if we want to print this page, we want to use points and cms. aboslute measurement styles.

---------------------IMAGE TYPES AND FORMATS--------- (fra GPS Aksdal inngangen, tar bilde mens hun lager en GIF)

Raster: 
- comes from cameras/scanner
- Formats: JPG, PNG, GIF; etc
- more pixels = larger file size 

Vector:
- software (illustrator)
- format: svg (scalable vector graphics)
- look sharp at any size, not made up of pixels. 

JPEG: 16M colors, not transparent, no animation
GIF: 256 colors, transparent, animation possible
PNG 16M colors, transparent, animation possible
WebP 16M colors, transparen, animation possible (not supported IE)

STYLESHEET: 
body {
  font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, Oxygen,
    Ubuntu, Cantarell, "Open Sans", "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;
  line-height: 1.5;
  padding: 1rem;
}

label {
  display: block;
}

input[type="text"],
[type="email"] {
  border: 1px solid #ccc;
  padding: 0.5rem 0rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
  transition: border-color 0.15s, box-shadow 0.15s;
  padding: 0.5rem 0.7rem;
}

input[type="text"]:focus,
input[type="email"]:focus {
  border-color: #7db0fb;
  outline: 0;
  box-shadow: 0 0 0 4px rgb(24, 117, 255, 0.25);
}

button {
  background: #4b85db;
  color: #fff;
  border: 0;
  border-radius: 5px;
  outline: 0;
}

.form-group {
  margin-bottom: 1rem;
}


body: sets fonts + padding of all the elements
Label: puts the name of the label on another block from the input 
Input: using the attribute selector it can chose property:values of the text within the input
Input: using the pseudo class selector for the attribute, we can change the proprety and values that are set for the focus selector
button:
- changing the default button border to 0. 
- border-radius rounding up the corners. 
- outline: 0 to set the color we want. 
.form-group

body {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
  height: 100vh;
}

.box {
  background-color: blue;
  height: 200px;
  width: 250px;
  overflow: hidden;
  transition: transform 5s, linear 5s;
}

.box:hover {
  transform: rotate(45deg);
}

We can use the transform 5s and linear 5s to let it happen in a linear style that takes 5 seconds. we can also set different background. 
we have to change it for the .box:hover as well. 

-----------------------------------------------ANIMATION-------------HUS I ÅLESUND, STIAN STÅR MED FRAMES foran tven,. 

body {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
  height: 100vh;
}

@keyframes pop {
  0% {
    transform: scale(1.5);
  }
  25% {
    transform: rotate(45deg);
  }
  50% {
    transform: scale(-1.5);
    background-color: aqua;
  }
  100% {
    transform: rotate(-45deg);
  }
}

.box {
  background-color: blue;
  height: 200px;
  width: 250px;
  overflow: hidden;
  transition: transform 5s, cubic-bezier(0.17, 0.67, 0.83, 0.67);
  animation-duration: 4s;
  animation-name: pop;
  animation-iteration-count: infinite;
  animation-direction: normal;
  animation-timing-function: cubic-bezier(0.075, 0.82, 0.165, 1);
}
